dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY RICHTER, 30's, pretty, driven and absolutely in cont walks through the lobby, greeting the SECURITY GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Abby. Another peaceful day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOY, 40's, the associate producer, falls in step with Abb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no problems, Joy.   Only solutions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky-cam on the traffic copter has a cracked lens and they can't fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's a problem. (thinking, then...) Call Matt Hardwick down at Media Services. He's got a few Sky Cams and he owes me. Now, where are my weathermen? Joy opens a door to a waiting area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several portly LATINO MEN look up and wave at Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys! Abby waves back and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the pot bellies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research shows people like fat weathermen. It makes them feel safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the one in the green and the one in the brown, but I want to see the one in the green with less sideburns and the one in the brown with more, then I'll make my decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby! LARRY, 50's, the pompous, uptight anchor man, catches up them. He wears a makeup bib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to do this to you, Abby, but I don't think I can work with her anymore. It's bad enough I have to take her criticism at home. I can't do it on air, too. A man can only take so much. Abby nods, taking him seriously, but you can tell she's d this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a man, Larry... (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a newsman. A newsman isn't defined by the easy times, Larry, he's defined by the difficult ones. Can you imagine Ted Koppel or Chris Hansen or Anderson Cooper having their wives as co-anchor? Hell, no, because they couldn't handle it. But you can. You've got balls the size of Volkswagens. Don't think I haven't noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LARRY (re his balls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've only thought of them as blue as of late, but you're right. They are quite sizeable. But not disproportionately so. (with pride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to think of them as aesthetically pleasing -- Abby steps away, not wanting to ponder Larry's balls anym than she has to. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've made my point. Larry nods, appeased, as she reaches the door marked ABBY RICHTER, PRODUCER, "ALBUQUERQUE A.M." She enters and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...walks in on a shouting match between JOSH, a leftist a news writer, and DORI, the entertainment-leaning co-write DORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh, nobody in Sacramento gives a crap about trees in Alaska! It's not newsworthy. JOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but full coverage on David Beckham's new tattoo is vital?! Larry's wife and co-anchor, GEORGIA, 40 and coiffed to th gills, storms in, followed by the show's GUEST CHEF. GEORGIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to kill me! He knows I can't eat crab, I'm allergic to it! (to the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone see this? Is this a hive? JOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like syphilis to me. DORI (to Josh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that? You wouldn't even know what syphilis looks like if it weren't for my story on Paris Hilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Abby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't eat crab or beef or fish. She doesn't eat anything but chicken. You don't need a chef on this show. You need a box of McNuggets. Everyone shouts at each other. Abby calmly pulls out a whistle, puts it to her mouth and BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameras roll as the chef happily cooks away on the set. Georgia and Larry taste samples of what he's prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to tell you, Bruce. This is the best Chicken Kiev I've ever tasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it's Duck Kiev. Duck makes an excellent alternative for chicken, Georgia. JAVIER, the new fat weatherman, takes a huge bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take home the leftovers? They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we return, our live Skycam traffic update and more on David Beckham's hundred thousand dollar tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what you can do to help preserve the ancient forests of Alaska -- and how it might help your Albuquerque electric bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby and Joy stand next to CLIFF, the show's director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to commercial. (to Abby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a matter of staring the chaos in the eye and showing it who's boss. Nice work, guys. She pats him on the back and heads out of the control roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Abby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart wants to see you. He's freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means he got the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby talks to STUART WARDLOW, 60's, KPHX's curmudgeonly general manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen the ratings for yesterday? We got beat by all the network shows, plus a rerun of "Who's the Boss". The one where the vacuum breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a temporary setback. This week we'll do better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy with the cable access show on Channel 83 does better. If we programed Jerry Springer re-runs, we'd do a nine share at a quarter the price. Abby looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me you're not thinking of killing the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not, but I can guarantee you that's what the new management's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart, "Sacramento AM" is an award- winning news program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Management doesn't listen to awards. It listens to numbers. We're not a family-run station anymore, Abby. You're good at what you do, but you've got to get me some numbers. I've got two daughters in college and a son in beauty school. I don't know how much you know about Vidal Sassoon but that shit ain't cheap. Abby nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can count on me, Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby and Joy stand at the sinks.     Abby compulsively fl in front of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be letting corporate management dictate the content of this show. This is my show. I control it. She rips out an extra two feet of floss. ABBY (cont'd)                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should cancel my date tonight and make a list of ideas for sweeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. You should be out, observing humanity. Humanity's who watches our show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, all 2.47% of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already rescheduled on this guy three times. You cancel tonight and he's gone. He's read more than a dozen books, he has a 401K and he's cute. She holds up her clipboard, which has the guy's E-Harmony PROFILE and PHOTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JOY (CONT'D) (cont'd) Look at this bone structure. This could be the bone structure of your future children. Don't you want them to be symmetrical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby stops flossing and looks at Joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You printed his profile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm married. I live vicariously through your dating life. And I really think that this could be our next boyfriend. C'mon, he had nine out of ten items on your checklist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, technically eight and a half. He said he could cook, but when I pressed him, he was completely unfamiliar with cumin. Don't you think that's a little suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Joy's look, we CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacramento's nicest restaurant. Diners enter and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby approaches the FEMALE HOSTESS, at her podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm looking for a guy with sandy brown hair, athletic build, and blue eyes... he's 5'9 which -- I know what you're thinking -- it's a little short, but he's read The Great Gatsby twice, so we'll just live with it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, I'm 5'9 and 3/4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, mortified, to see JIM, 30's and good-looking. Actually, he's better looking in person than in his photo Abby gulps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JIM (cont'd) But I'll read Gatsby again if that makes it any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim -- hey. Hi. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I show you to your table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby and a mildly perturbed Jim follow, clearly not off t banner start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby and Jim sit at a table. Abby looks around, tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? This is not the best angle. We should get the table over there. Then we both get a view, instead of one of us looking at the busboy station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, trust me. It'll be better over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her like she's crazy, as they get up and move

dialogues.speaker: ANTOHER TABLE
dialogues.text: The waiter is now taking their drink order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you some water for the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottle of flat, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they've done studies that show tap water is no different from bottled water. And they passed a law recently to have all restaurants filter their tap water. So, technically it's not tap water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ABBY (cont'd) It's filtered water, which is exactly what bottled water is, except you don't have to pay $7 for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I still like the way it tastes better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you any cocktails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotch on the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your profile, you said you liked red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, I just feel like having a scotch right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks disappointed, then pulls out a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the paper) Was there anything else you changed your mind about? I mean, just so I can figure it into the overall picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You printed out my profile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, my associate producer did. She likes me to be prepared. Not that I'm ever not prepared. Kudos on your comprehensive car insurance policy, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't in my profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it was in your background check. (off his look; changing the subject) So...tell me about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's left that you don't know? ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point. There's an awkward silence between them. She pulls out another piece of paper, and hands it to him. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I printed out some talking points for us just in case this happened. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it it's happened before? ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but since you have nine out of ten of the necessary attributes on my checklist, I just wanted to make sure this goes as smoothly as possible. As Jim processes this, the waiter arrives with drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He takes a huge sip, relieved. Abby looks at him. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize the ice in that scotch is made from tap water, don't you? He looks at her, realizing she's a complete nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RESTAURANT PARKING LOT- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jim and Abby walk to their cars. Jim is walking faster th she is, trying to get away. She trots along, trying to ke up. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time we could go bowling. I noticed online that you're the mid- ranked amateur in the state. I mean, if there is a next time. I'm not trying to be presumptuous, but I am getting a pretty good vibe here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jim doesn't even consider refuting this. He just wants to leave. Abby reaches into her purse and pulls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no thanks.   It's late.   I should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets into his car as she hands him his doggy bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FYI, be sure to eat this by tomorrow. With curry, you can't smell if it's gone bad, so after three days, you should just toss it. Really, don't even give it to a pet or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days. Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby has officially lost control to the producer part of herself...she knows what she's doing, but can't stop hers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, just to be sure, I'll write today's date on it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby takes a pen out and writes a date on the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) It's fine, really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottom of the bag gives out and a container of goopy leftovers SPILLS all over Jim's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) I told them to double bag this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna -- go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim closes the door, catching the hem of Abby's wrap skir ABBY (CONT'D) (cont'd) Wait, my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The car speeds off -- RIPPING Abby's skirt right off her it races away. Abby is left standing in her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, still in her undies, trudges up the steps. She open her front door. Her calico cat D'ARTAGNAN, 9, skeptical a easily annoyed, stares up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, now in pajamas, flosses her teeth. She hears a nois coming from her bedroom and looks to see D'Artagnan's paw the fish bowl, trying to scoop up a goldfish. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Artagnan! Stop that! Abby picks up the cat. ABBY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times do I have to tell you? Leave Juliet alone. Wasn't Romeo enough for you? Abby picks up the remote, snaps the TV on to "Nightline" Brian Williams. ABBY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a man. Not some five foot nine scotch drinker who lies about cumin. She heads into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Abby flosses in front of the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...D'Artagnan hisses at the TV and steps on the remote control. ON TV - the channel jumps to a cable access show. MIKE ALEXANDER, 30's, handsome but not pretty, proudly dressed an outfit that costs less than fifty dollars, addresses t camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the truth! But you can't handle the truth. `Cause it's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE THEME SONG for "The Ugly Truth" kicks in over a serie past scenes: Mike judo-kicking an giant Oprah doll. Sever posters spelling the word "LOVE" are destroyed by Mike wi variety of weapons. The theme sequence ends and CUTS TO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Ugly Truth", live on air. The look of the show's set low-rent cable TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mike Alexander and we're back with the "The Ugly Truth." Tonight, as always, we're going to talk about what it is men and women really want in relationships. I've been looking through some books...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up several books in his hands, reading the title

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Smart Women Foolish Choices", "Women Who Love Men Who Hate Them", "Hating Men Who Love Women But Hate Loving Men"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the books on the floor, picks up a can of gasoli and pours it on the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billions and billions of dollars wasted on self-help psychoВ­babble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike lights a match and tosses it on the books, setting t ablaze. Then opens up his jacket and takes out a stick wi marshmallow. Begins roasting the marshmallow on the flame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen up, ladies, cause I'm only gonna say this once tonight and it's just three little words. No, they're not "I love you." Here goes... MEN. ARE. SIMPLE. We can not be trained. All this "Men Are From Venus" bullshit is a waste of your time and money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be a lonely hag, then keep reading these stupid books. You want a relationship, here's how you get one: it's called a Stairmaster. Get on it and get skinny and get some trashy lingerie because at the end of the day, all we're interested in is looks. No one falls in love with your personality at first sight, they fall in love with your tits and your ass. And they stick around because of what you're willing to do with them. You want to win a man over? You don't need ten steps. You need one. And it's called a blow- job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike shoves a burnt marshmallow into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forget to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mimes swallowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN off the television to the bed, where Abby now watc appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. It's that cable access jackass Stuart was talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you burn those books? They've helped my personal life more than --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your boyfriend's name, princess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not seeing anyone right now but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point exactly, Shrek. Next caller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, now infuriated, picks up the phone and begins diali WE INTERCUT between the stage and her apartment, as Mike continues his rant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men don't fall in love. Men fall in "want." We want things. We're hunters and gatherers. We're the same as we were when we were cavemen and a gillion years of evolution hasn't done squat. Trust me, there was a Pamela Anderson of cave women and all the cave guys were trying to stick their dicks in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks over to a chalk board with the word "LOVE" on He crosses it out and writes "LUST." MIKE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Now girls, if you want to think lust is the same as love, that's fine, but you're delusional. Let's take some more calls. (picks up the phone) You're on the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is now on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying men are incapable of love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I burst your little Harlequin Romance bubble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irritated, Abby begins to compulsively remake her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing you burst is your credibility. Men are absolutely capable of experiencing love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll bite. Who's the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy, Mr. Wonderful, the one who's so capable of love. Who is he? What's he like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's not like you, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's smart...he's handsome but doesn't know it... (enjoying the fantasy) He's successful, but in a job that means something. He loves red wine, classical music, Cary Grant movies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a guy in America, right? You're not calling from Europe or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you interested in listening or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please. I'm loving this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works out, not because he's vain, because it's healthy. He's socially liberal but fiscally conservative. He likes dogs but he's a cat person. He never gets out of bed before you on a Sunday morning --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. You're a lesbian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're describing a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are those qualities so threatening to you? Perhaps because your complete lack of any one of them is the real reason why women aren't interested in you. At least women of quality. Mike scoffs, but he's thrown. He takes a moment, then... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this guy? I will give you one hundred dollars of my own money to bring him down here and let me meet him. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's out there...somewhere. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. You're not even dating this guy?! ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no...I'm just describing a type...I thought that's what we were doing. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know him?!? Mike bowls over LAUGHING. Abby realizes she's been had. MIKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on...whoa...now I get the whole picture. You're a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? She rips the perfectly made bed apart and starts over. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. You must be. If you were hot, you'd be out breaking some poor schmuck's heart instead of spending all your time fantasizing about Mr. Wonderful. Face it, you're ugly! ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not ugly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course you don't think so. Ugly people never know they're ugly. It's like people who have B.O. They never know it because they're surrounded by their own stench all the time. Now Abby's really fuming. She snaps a sheet violently. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the most ridic -- MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, lemme help you out here. You might as well just face the fact that you're gonna be alone and stop pining away for some fantasy guy you're never going to get. Get a hobby. Build housing for the poor. Anything. ABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stares at Abby on TV for a second, then grabs his ke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm all over this. He races out, as Jonah calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she's into you,guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and the camera guy watch as Abby gains steam, ranting the camera. B-CAMERA, strapped to the basket, also record

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big, strong, romantic men we've been reading about in novels and watching in movies since we were nine? They're fallacies. "Blue Lagoon" is a total freakin' lie. Men are not strong. Men are not brave. Men are afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the news desk, Georgia and Larry watch the monitor, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love "Blue Lagoon". Georgia squeezes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's truck careens into the parking lot. He gets out, racing towards the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is now on a total tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They're afraid to say what they feel. Afraid to grow up. Afraid to tell the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah watches, entranced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like she's in his brain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pushes through the crowd of balloon lovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby continues her impassioned tirade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if they have a moment in a hotel elevator that's totally romantic and filled with potential, men are completely incapable of copping to it. Because men are weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something about women. She turns to see -- MIKE standing there. He pushes past Joy and climbs into t balloon. Grabbing the mic from Abby's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her; to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women would have us believe that they are the victims. They aren't. They want us to think that we break their hearts for sport. That's crap. They say they want romance. They say they want true love, but all they want is a checklist. Is he perfect? Is he handsome? Is he a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confused Cliff looks at Stuart, who's still on the phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now elated; into phone) See? I told you she'd get him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby glares at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BY THE CAMERAMAN, Joy shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, kinda true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike continues his rant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You men that fit the criteria -- don't kid yourselves. They're not sleeping with you. They're sleeping with a carefully calculated set of venal choices. Money over substance. Looks over soul. Polish over principles. No gesture, no matter how real or romantic, will ever compensate for a really impressive list of credentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says the man who's never made a gesture except for this one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes the universally known "jack-off" hand gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the elevator wasn't a gesture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator was a moment of passion, followed by a moment of panic on your part, apparently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart looks at Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What elevator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike glares at Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came by your room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you ran away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that wasn't panic, sweetheart. It was an unwillingness to compete with the walking checklist that was in your bed. You should be thanking me. NEARBY, Joy taps her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have ten seconds. An OVERZEALOUS BALLOON PILOT walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we ready to soar up, up and away? IN THE BASKET, Mike looks at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the Ugly Truth, folks. A girl in heat for two guys will always pick the one with the better resume. BEHIND HIM, the Pilot silently boards the balloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is bullsh -- The TORCH of the BALLOON is suddenly fired, covering her violation. The cameraman follows the balloon as it slowly starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And we're out. (then; sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep rolling on B-camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby glares at Mike, not realizing they're still on the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you so much I just swore on live television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you hate yourself for being so shallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off we go! Abby and Mike spin around to look at him.       Realizing balloon is now soaring upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere with you. Mike starts to climb out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a shock. You're bailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't recommend that... Mike looks down to see -- They are now FIFTEEN FEET ABOVE THE GROUND. And rising. stops climbing, as the balloon continues to float up and away. PILOT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, who wants champagne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart and Cliff stare at the monitors, eating it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know the camera is on, do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now holding champagne glasses, a disgusted Mike and Abby at opposite ends of the sky, hating that they are trapped together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I know -- we can pass the time with you telling me how much fun you and Colin had having sex in Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke up with Colin in Los Angeles, jackass. Mike is thrown, turning to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To our left, we have the Sandia Mountains, glistening in the afternoon twilight... Abby ignores the pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that got your interest? If you think we're going to finish what we started in LA, you're out of your mind. You lost your chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to our right, you'll see the Rio Grande River winding its way through the diochramatic landscape... Mike ignores the pilot as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never had a chance with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And off in the distance, we have the Petroglyph National Monument, where --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stop talking, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ABBY (cont'd) (to Mike) You're right. I had a momentary lapse in judgement where I thought you might be more than you are. But you aren't. Clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking) "I'm Mike Alexander. I like girls in Jello. I like to fuck like a monkey. Don't fall in love -- it's `scary.'"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy talks on the phone to Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I saw this coming, so I got us a three second delay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike glares at Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is "scary." It's fucking terrifying. Especially because I'm in love with a psycho like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah now sits with Elizabeth.       They both stare at t shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he just say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Love"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia and Larry look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby stares at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a psycho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you I loved you and all you heard was "psycho". You are the definition of neurotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The definition of neurotic is a person who suffers from anxiety, obsessional thoughts, compulsive acts and physical ailments without having any objective evidence of disease --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, I just told you I'm in love with you and you're standing here giving me a vocabulary lesson. (to the Pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back me up on this, buddy...who here is afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to drink my champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in love with me.      Really. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats the shit out of me, but I am. Abby opens her mouth, about to make a retort, then realiz what's been said to her. For the first time in her life, stops thinking and -- Grabs Mike and kisses the hell out of him. The sheer forc her kissing THROWS them into the pilot, causing -- The torch to FLAME radically. The balloon WHOOSHES upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elated Stuart picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy, how do you feel about a promotion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone, Joy hi-fives the cameraman, then quickly composes herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel good about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby finally loosens her grip on Mike. Hair askew, he loo little like he's been hit by a cyclone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say "just kidding", I'm going to throw you out of this balloon and watch your body splatter to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to threaten me with death when we have sex? Because it might be distracting. The Pilot looks worried for his safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I suggest you wait until we land? Abby and Mike keep kissing as the balloon sails into the sunset, and we FADE TO BLACK, then CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Mike, as he addresses the camera. He holds a mic wears a tuxedo and speaks in a hushed voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As many of you know, sometimes a guy's gotta admit what he thought was the truth isn't necessarily the whole truth. Yes, women have a checklist, but sometimes that list includes a foul-mouthed idiot who took way too long to realize he was in love. (holds up a finger) Let's continue this conversation in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PULL BACK to REVEAL -- Mike is standing in a garden with rows and rows of WEDDIN GUESTS seated behind him. An altar with flowers and a minister wait patiently. Mike gestures for the camera to follow him as he makes hi way up to the altar. As he arrives he greets his groomsman, JONAH, also wearin tux. He only has eyes for Joy, Abby's bridesmaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joy) Has anyone ever told you you have a stupendous bosom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not lately, so feel free to say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A string quartet's version of "HERE COMES THE BRIDE" begi as we PAN OVER to see -- ABBY, in a wedding dress, about to make her way up the ai Looking absolutely beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wowed; to camera) Zoom in on this, guys. I want the whole city to see how lucky I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cameraman ZOOMS IN on Abby, as she catches Mike's eye smiles. IN THE AUDIENCE, Elizabeth takes photo after photo. Her d -- a dead ringer for Jim Morrison -- looks at her, amused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No one's ever going to believe this. I need proof. AT THE ALTAR, Abby finally arrives and looks at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the cameras)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you don't mind, but we're live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the cameraman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what's Jorge doing so close? We need a master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...I'm the producer. It's sweeps week. How do you think I got them to pay for this? She gestures to -- BOB and HAROLD from Corporate, who sit the audience. Mike looks momentarily surprised, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I love you. He turns to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, here it is, guys. The games, the manipulation, the ploys, the tactics... all the things we do to think we're in control. But guess what? We never are. Abby leans over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'THE UGLY TRUTH' - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She smiles as we --
